snippet: Soon after Johnson & Johnson recalled a troubled hip implant, an internal review found that the company’s orthopedic unit had used inadequate engineering standards.
abstract: Court testimony shows that internal 2010 review at Johnson & Johnson found that company had not adequately assessed risks of recalled hip implants before they were marketed and used in more than 90,0000 patients; findings are introduced as evidence in first of more than 10,000 lawsuits related to the implants.
lead_paragraph: Soon after Johnson & Johnson recalled a troubled hip implant, an internal review found that the company’s orthopedic unit had used inadequate engineering standards.

headline.seo: Hip Implant’s Risks Inadequately Assessed, DePuy Report Found in 2010
headline.main: Implant Risk Was Assessed Inadequately, Court Is Told
